description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，原副国级领导人。曾任香港特别行政区第一及第二届行政长官、第十至第十三届全国政协副主席。他于1992年被任命为行政局非官守成员，2014年创立团结香港基金会。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China and a former national-level deputy leader. He served as the first and second Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and as Vice Chairman of the 10th to 13th National Committees of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference. He was appointed as an unofficial member of the Executive Council in 1992 and founded the Our Hong Kong Foundation in 2014.

description.zh-cn: 香港航业巨头，董建华之父。
description.en: Hong Kong shipping magnate, father of Tung Chee-hwa.

description.zh-cn: 董建华之母。
description.en: Mother of Tung Chee-hwa.

description.zh-cn: 末任香港总督。
description.en: The last Governor of Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 前中共中央总书记。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 前中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: Former Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 香港特别行政区行政长官

zh-cn: 香港特别行政区行政长官

description.zh-cn: 前中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: Former Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 前香港特别行政区行政长官。
description.en: Former Chief Executive of Hong Kong.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会副主席

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会副主席
en: Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference

description.zh-cn: 六七暴动期间任斗委会主任。
description.en: Served as the director of the Struggle Committee during the 1967 Hong Kong riots.

description.zh-cn: 香港首位华人布政司及首任政务司司长。
description.en: The first ethnic Chinese Chief Secretary of Hong Kong and the first Chief Secretary for Administration.

description.zh-cn: 前中华人民共和国国务院副总理。
description.en: Former Vice Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 香港基本法第二十三条

zh-cn: 香港基本法第二十三条
en: Article 23 of the Hong Kong Basic Law

description.zh-cn: 前中共中央总书记、中国国家主席。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee and President of China.

description.zh-cn: 由董浩云创立的航运公司，曾由董建华继承。
description.en: A shipping company founded by Tung Hao-yung, later inherited by Tung Chee-hwa.

en: Government of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1986年，东方海外遭遇财务危机，获中华人民共和国政府透过霍英东注资而得以渡过难关。
description.en: In 1986, Orient Overseas faced a financial crisis and was bailed out with an investment from the PRC government through Henry Fok.

description.zh-cn: 1986年，霍英东向遭遇财务危机的东方海外注资，助其渡过难关。
description.en: In 1986, Henry Fok injected capital into the financially troubled Orient Overseas, helping it survive the crisis.

description.zh-cn: 1992年10月，时任香港总督彭定康委任董建华为香港行政局非官守议员，使其踏足政界。
description.en: In October 1992, then-Governor Chris Patten appointed Tung Chee-hwa as an unofficial member of the Executive Council, marking his entry into politics.

description.zh-cn: 1996年1月，在香港特区筹委会成立时，时任中共中央总书记江泽民仅与董建华一人握手，此举被普遍解读为“钦点”其为首任行政长官。
description.en: In January 1996, at the establishment of the HKSAR Preparatory Committee, then-General Secretary of the CPC Jiang Zemin shook hands only with Tung Chee-hwa, an act widely interpreted as an official endorsement for him to become the first Chief Executive.

description.zh-cn: 时任国务院总理李鹏签署国务院令，任命董建华为香港首任行政长官。
description.en: Then-Premier Li Peng signed a State Council order appointing Tung Chee-hwa as the first Chief Executive of Hong Kong.

relationships.target: 香港特别行政区行政长官

description.zh-cn: 在1996年香港特别行政区行政长官选举中，董建华为杨铁梁的竞争对手并最终获胜。
description.en: In the 1996 Hong Kong Chief Executive election, Tung Chee-hwa was a competitor to Yang Ti-liang and ultimately won.

description.zh-cn: 在1996年香港特别行政区行政长官选举中，董建华为吴光正的竞争对手并最终获胜。
description.en: In the 1996 Hong Kong Chief Executive election, Tung Chee-hwa was a competitor to Peter Woo and ultimately won.

description.zh-cn: 在1996年香港特别行政区行政长官选举中，董建华为李福善的竞争对手并最终获胜。
description.en: In the 1996 Hong Kong Chief Executive election, Tung Chee-hwa was a competitor to Li Fook-sin and ultimately won.

description.zh-cn: 时任国务院总理朱镕基委任董建华为第二任香港行政长官。
description.en: Then-Premier Zhu Rongji appointed Tung Chee-hwa for his second term as Chief Executive of Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 董建华辞职后，由时任政务司司长曾荫权接任行政长官。
description.en: After Tung Chee-hwa's resignation, then-Chief Secretary for Administration Donald Tsang succeeded him as Chief Executive.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会副主席

description.zh-cn: 陈智思接替董建华出任团结香港基金会主席。
description.en: Bernard Chan succeeded Tung Chee-hwa as the Chairman of the Our Hong Kong Foundation.

description.zh-cn: 董建华在1997年施政报告中宣布了“八万五建屋计划”。
description.en: Tung Chee-hwa announced the '85,000 housing units policy' in his 1997 policy address.

description.zh-cn: 亚洲金融风暴爆发后，楼价急跌，导致“八万五建屋计划”事实上无法推行，并于1998年后不再被提起。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Asian financial crisis, property prices plummeted, making the '85,000 housing units policy' effectively untenable, and it was no longer mentioned after 1998.

description.zh-cn: 居屋短桩事件是董建华任内最严重的公营房屋丑闻，严重影响了其政府的声誉。
description.en: The short-piling scandal was the most severe public housing scandal during Tung Chee-hwa's tenure, seriously damaging his government's reputation.

description.zh-cn: 其高级特别助理路祥安被指干预香港大学的民意调查，事件损害了董建华及特区政府的声誉。
description.en: His Senior Special Assistant, Andrew Lo, was accused of interfering with public opinion polls at the University of Hong Kong, an incident that damaged the reputation of Tung and the HKSAR government.

description.zh-cn: 在港大民调风波中，路祥安在董建华的力保下得以留任。
description.en: During the HKU polling controversy, Andrew Lo retained his position with Tung Chee-hwa's strong support.

description.zh-cn: 于2001年向六七暴动期间的斗委会主任杨光颁发大紫荆勋章，引起社会极大争议。
description.en: In 2001, he awarded the Grand Bauhinia Medal to Yeung Kwong, the director of the Struggle Committee during the 1967 riots, which sparked significant public controversy.

description.zh-cn: 董建华与时任政务司司长陈方安生在治港政策上存在分歧，坊间普遍传言二人不和。陈方安生最终因无法说服董建华放弃推行高官问责制而提早辞职。
description.en: Tung Chee-hwa and then-Chief Secretary for Administration Anson Chan had disagreements on Hong Kong's governance policies, and it was widely rumored that they were at odds. Chan eventually resigned early due to her inability to persuade Tung to abandon the implementation of the Principal Officials Accountability System.

description.zh-cn: 2001年，时任副总理钱其琛召见陈方安生上北京述职，期间要求她好好支持行政长官。此后不久，陈方安生宣布辞职。
description.en: In 2001, then-Vice Premier Qian Qichen summoned Anson Chan to Beijing to report on her duties, during which he asked her to fully support the Chief Executive. Shortly thereafter, Chan announced her resignation.

description.zh-cn: 董建华在其第二届任期开始时推行高官问责制。
description.en: Tung Chee-hwa implemented the Principal Officials Accountability System at the beginning of his second term.

relationships.target: 香港基本法第二十三条

description.zh-cn: 董建华政府于2002年试图就《基本法》第23条进行立法，但在巨大争议下于2003年撤回草案。
description.en: The Tung administration attempted to legislate Article 23 of the Basic Law in 2002, but withdrew the bill in 2003 amid significant controversy.

relationships.target: 香港基本法第二十三条

description.zh-cn: 超过50万市民上街游行反对23条立法，最终迫使政府搁置并撤回该法案。
description.en: Over 500,000 citizens marched to protest the Article 23 legislation, ultimately forcing the government to shelve and withdraw the bill.

description.zh-cn: 游行中的一个主要诉求是要求董建华下台，严重打击了其管治威信。
description.en: A major demand of the protest was for Tung Chee-hwa to step down, which severely undermined his governing authority.

description.zh-cn: 时任国家主席胡锦涛在澳门公开要求董建华及其团队“总结经验、查找不足”，被外界广泛视为对其表现不满的信号，成为其最终辞职的催化剂。
description.en: Then-President Hu Jintao publicly asked Tung Chee-hwa and his team to 'summarize experiences and find shortcomings' in Macau, which was widely seen as a signal of dissatisfaction with his performance and a catalyst for his eventual resignation.

description.zh-cn: 董建华政府在未经公开招标的情况下，将数码港项目批给李泽楷的盈科拓展，引发官商勾结的争议。
description.en: The Tung administration awarded the Cyberport project to Richard Li's PCCW without a public tender, sparking controversy over alleged government-business collusion.

description.zh-cn: 董建华政府在未经公开招标的情况下，将数码港项目批给李泽楷的盈科拓展，此举被外界批评为官商勾结，显示出两者之间存在优待关系。
description.en: The Tung administration awarded the Cyberport project to Richard Li's PCCW without a public tender, a move criticized by the public as government-business collusion, indicating a preferential relationship between them.
